00020 /**
00021  * @file   ProgressDot.h
00022  * @author Chuck Sugnet
00023  * @date   Fri Jan 27 14:57:49 2006
00024  * 
00025  * @brief ProgressHandler for the console that prints dots to the command line
00026  * to signify progress.
00027  */
00028 
00029 #ifndef PROGRESSDOT_H
00030 #define PROGRESSDOT_H
00031 
00032 //
00033 #include "util/ProgressHandler.h"
00034 #include "util/Convert.h"
00035 //
00036 #include <cstdio>
00037 #include <cstring>
00038 #include <fstream>
00039 #include <iostream>
00040 #include <string>
00041 #include <time.h>
00042 //
00043 
00044 /**
00045  * @brief Prints dots as progress is made.
00046  */
00047 class ProgressDot : public ProgressHandler {
00048 
00049 public:
00050 
00051   /** 
00052    * Constructor that takes an stream for doing outputs and level at
00053    * which to print messages.
00054    * 
00055    * @param out - 
00056    * @param verbosity 
00057    * 
00058    * @return 
00059    */
00060   ProgressDot(int verbosity, std::ostream *out) {
00061     m_Total=0;
00062     m_Verbosity = verbosity;
00063     m_Out = out;
00064   }
00065 
00066   /** 
00067    * Begin a progress reporting. After this initial call the
00068    * progressStep call will be called N times where N = the parameter
00069    * total passed in below.
00070    * 
00071    * @param verbosity - What level of verbosity is the progress
00072    * associated with. Higher levels of verbosity produce more
00073    * messages.
00074    * @param msg - String message associated with the beginning of this task.
00075    * @param total - Expected number of times that the progressStep()
00076    * will be called after this.
00077    */
00078   void progressBegin(int verbosity, const std::string &msg, int total) {
00079     m_Total = total;
00080     // flush any C io before doing our IO
00081     fflush(NULL); 
00082     m_StartTime = time(NULL);
00083     if(verbosity <= m_Verbosity && m_Out != NULL) {
00084       (*m_Out) << msg;
00085       m_Out->flush();
00086     }
00087   }
00088 
00089   /** 
00090    * This function is called when one unit of work has been done. In
00091    * general it is expected that the units of work should be roughly
00092    * equal in size.
00093    * 
00094    * @param verbosity - At what verbosity level should this step be
00095    * displayed.
00096    */
00097   void progressStep(int verbosity) {
00098     if(verbosity <= m_Verbosity && m_Out != NULL) {
00099       m_Out->put('.');
00100       m_Out->flush();
00101     }
00102   }
00103 
00104   /** 
00105    * Signals the end of progress report. 
00106    * 
00107    * @param verbosity - Level of verbosity associated with this progress report.
00108    * @param msg - Closing message from calling function.
00109    */
00110   void progressEnd(int verbosity, const std::string &msg) {
00111     time_t endTime = time(NULL);
00112     int t = int(  (float)(endTime - m_StartTime) / 60.0 * 100); // convert to minutes
00113     if(verbosity <= m_Verbosity && m_Out != NULL) {
00114       (*m_Out) << msg << " (" << ToStr((float)t/100) << " min)" << std::endl;
00115       m_Out->flush();
00116     }
00117   }
00118 
00119 private:
00120   std::ostream *m_Out; ///< Stream to print messages to. Can be NULL to indicate no printing.
00121   int m_Total;         ///< How many steps total are we expecting?
00122   time_t m_StartTime;
00123 };
00124 
00125 #endif /* PROGRESSDOT_H */
